intro: Appendicula fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered appendicula, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of tiny, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes, often in moist, temperate climates. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, and it blooms during the spring and early summer. Appendicula fasciculata is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and unique appearance.
